intro: Flindersia tysoni, commonly known as the Northern Flindersia, is a tropical tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, coastal environments and is often found in rainforests. Its ornamental value and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
